title: Pak Army Chief Promoted To Field Marshal After Operation Sindoor Drubbing
content: Pakistan Army chief General Asim Munir has been promoted to the topmost military rank of Field Marshal - an honour given only in the rarest of occasions and on achieving a stellar operations record throughout a career in the armed forces.

title: Exclusive: When Army Destroyed 13 Enemy Posts Within 3 Minutes Of Pak Firing
content: Two weeks after India launched 'Operation Sindoor' against terror bases in Pakistan, NDTV reached a high-altitude army post that sits on the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch and overlooks a hill.

title: Delhi Man Beaten, Stabbed To Death For Objecting To Sister's Relationship
content: A 27-year-old man was allegedly beaten and stabbed to death by a group of three persons in west Delhi's Khyala area after he objected to the relationship between his sister and one of the accused, a police official said on Tuesday.

title: Blog: Blog | Whatever Happened To 'Working From Home'? Why Your Boss Wants You Back In Office
content: In India, where the tech sector gamely followed Silicon Valley into 'WFH', there is now growing pressure to follow it right back into the office - just like its Silicon Valley big brother.

title: Man Attacks Woman In Mumbai Local, Claims She Abused His Mother
content: An ugly fight broke out between two passengers on a Mumbai local after a man accused a woman of abusing his mother.

title: India Offers Sustainable Approach To Global South's Health Challenges: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the future of a healthy world depends on inclusion, integrated vision and collaboration, as he asserted that India's approach offers sustainable models to meet the health challenges of the Global South.

title: NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal Takes Oath As Maharashtra Minister
content: Senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Chhagan Bhujbal on Tuesday morning took oath as a minister in the Mahayuti-led Maharashtra government at Raj Bhavan in Mumbai.

title: Low Income Migrants Slapped With $1.8m Fine By US Immigration Officials
content: In the last few weeks, U.S. President Donald Trump has started to operationalize a plan to fine migrants who fail to leave the U.S. after a final deportation order, issuing notices to 4,500 migrants with penalties totaling more than $500 million.

title: Ashoka University Professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad Sent To 14-Day Judicial Custody Over Post On Op Sindoor
content: Ali Khan Mahmudabad, the Ashoka University professor, who was arrested for a social media post about Operation Sindoor, which critics say is far from objectionable, was on Tuesday sent to 14-day judicial custody.

title: Iran's Khamenei Says Talks With US Unlikely To "Lead To Any Outcome"
content: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said Tuesday that nuclear talks with the United States were unlikely to yield any results, amid a diplomatic standoff over the Islamic republic's enrichment activities.

title: Israeli Politician Says 'Shouldn't Kill Babies For A Hobby', Sparks Row
content: Israeli government and opposition leaders condemned on Tuesday a left-wing politician, Yair Golan, after he said in a radio interview that "a sane country... does not kill babies for a hobby".

title: Operation Sindoor "Small War"? BJP's Sambit Patra Rips Into Congress
content: The Congress's contention that Operation Sindoor was a "small war" has sparked vehement objection from the BJP.

title: Geeta Samota Becomes 1st Paramilitary Force CISF Personnel To Climb Mount Everest
content: Sub Inspector Geeta Samota has become the first CISF personnel to conquer the world's tallest peak, Mount Everest, in the 56-year-long history of the force, a spokesperson said Tuesday.

title: Serial Killer Who Fed Victims To Crocodiles Arrested From Rajasthan: Police
content: A notorious serial killer infamous as 'Doctor Death' was arrested by Delhi Police after he jumped parole last year, a senior official said on Tuesday.

title: Hoarding Falls In Pune Amid Heavy Rain, 7 Two-Wheelers Trapped
content: A hoarding fell, crushing several two-wheelers, due to heavy rain and strong winds in Pune on Tuesday. No one was, fortunately, injured in the accident, but it brought back horrific memories of a similar collapse in Mumbai's Ghatkopar last year.

title: Ranya Rao Gets Bail In Gold Smuggling Case But Will Stay In Jail. Here's Why
content: Kannada actor Ranya Rao, who was arrested for smuggling gold bars worth Rs 14.56 crore in March, was granted bail by a special court on Tuesday.

title: "Unfortunate That...": Supreme Court Grants Bail To Man Arrested In Cheating Case
content: The Supreme Court has granted bail to a partially blind man arrested in a cheating case, underlining his misfortune that he had to "travel up to this court for getting bail".

title: Spain Now Hit With Network Outage, Weeks After Nationwide Blackout
content: The outage also had serious implications for emergency services, disrupting access to the EU-wide emergency number 112 in several regions. Authorities quickly responded by issuing alternative contact numbers to ensure public safety.

title: Syria's Driest Winter In 7 Decades Triggers Severe Water Crisis In Damascus
content: Inside a mountain above the Syrian capital, Hassan Bashi walked through tunnels that used to be filled with water from a spring famous for its pure waters.

title: 1 Killed, 5 Injured After Four-Storey Building Collapses In Thane
content: A slab collapse in a four story building in Thane District on Tuesday left one dead and five injured.

title: NBA horoscopes: What's in the stars for each conference finals team?
content: What does the Zodiac have to say about the Knicks, Thunder, Pacers and Wolves? Neil Paine shares his reading.

title: Playoff MVPs: Herring's new top 8 after the conference semis
content: Our playoff MVP update features a Game 7 savior, two Wolves and a superstar who hasn't played in three weeks.

title: Sources: NFL to OK flag football for '28 Olympics
content: A vote on whether to allow NFL players to participate in flag football at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics is expected to pass at Tuesday's league meeting, sources told ESPN.

title: Clark, Fever back investigation: No place for hate
content: Fever players on Monday supported the WNBA's investigation into allegations of "hateful fan comments" toward the Sky's Angel Reese.

title: After Soto admires single, manager wants to chat
content: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said he'll talk to Juan Soto about hustling out of the batter's box, while Soto claimed it hasn't been an issue.

title: Sources: Bears, Thuney agree to $35M extension
content: Two-time All-Pro guard Joe Thuney, who was traded to the Bears in March, has reached a two-year contract extension, his agent said.

title: Sources: 49ers make Warner NFL's top-paid LB
content: Linebacker Fred Warner and the 49ers reached agreement on a three-year, $63 million contract extension that includes over $56 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Packers submit revision for tush push proposal
content: With the NFL's league meetings set to open up in Minneapolis on Tuesday, the Packers submitted a revision of their rule proposal that would more broadly ban pushing or pulling the ball carrier anywhere on the field, a strategy popularized by the Eagles.

title: Bucs owner: Rice 'overdue' for Hall of Fame call
content: Buccaneers co-owner Bryan Glazer said Monday that "it's time to rectify that oversight" of Simeon Rice not yet being in the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: NHL referee Rooney OK, hopes for playoff return
content: NHL referee Chris Rooney is hoping to resume duties during the Stanley Cup playoffs after taking a high stick to the eye in Game 7 of the second-round Eastern Conference playoff series between the Toronto Maple Leafs and Florida Panthers on Sunday night.

title: 🆕 Predicting Rounds 1 and 2 of the NBA draft
content: After Cooper Flagg, the draft could get interesting. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: The NFL is excited about Olympic flag football, but will its stars participate? Not everyone is on board
content: A vote Tuesday is expected to pave the way for players such as Patrick Mahomes and Tyreek Hill to play Olympic flag football.

title: Real or not? Debating whether the Tigers, Cardinals and other unexpected teams are playoff contenders
content: We offer an early postseason verdict on five of MLB's most surprising teams almost two months into the 2025 season.

content: With the NBA Finals just a round away, our experts break down how each team got here and what we are hearing about each series.

title: Who wins the Eastern Conference finals? Keys to Hurricanes-Panthers
content: It's a rematch of the 2023 edition. Can Carolina win this time, or will Florida head back to the Cup Final?

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Lynx replace Liberty at No. 1, Fever climb to No. 3
content: Minnesota, New York and Indiana are 1-2-3 in Week 1, but which team climbed eight spots from our preseason rankings?

title: The gauntlet of the SEC baseball tournament and what to know going in
content: For the very first time, all 16 SEC teams will get to participate in this year's conference baseball tournament.

title: No QBs allowed: We name the 25 best non-QB players for 2025
content: It's not all about quarterbacks. These players could have a big impact on 2025, even if they don't throw a pass.

title: Latest men's Bracketology: UConn emerges as a No. 1 seed for 2025-26
content: With Alex Karaban among the returning players, the Huskies crack the top line of our latest projected field.

title: How proposed CEO could dole out punishments in college sports
content: A decision on the House case is expected as soon as this week and could come with enforcement changes.

title: Five fringe players who deserve a call-up for USMNT Gold Cup team
content: With results far from convincing, the USMNT needs fresh blood. Could these players get minutes at the Gold Cup?

title: Which Europa League finalist has had a worse season: Man United or Spurs?
content: Man United and Spurs have both had historically bad seasons but, somehow, one of them will win a European trophy and qualify for the Champions League.

title: Sources: United closing in on $83M Cunha deal
content: Manchester United are growing increasingly confident that they will land Matheus Cunha from Wolves this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: Kaká on links with Ancelotti, Brazil: 'I'm ready'
content: Former Brazil icon Kaká addressed reports that he is in talks to join Carlo Ancelotti's backroom staff, saying he is "ready" to help his country at the 2026 World Cup should he get the opportunity.

title: Man United trio back in training before UEL final
content: Ruben Amorim has been handed a boost ahead of the Europa League final after Leny Yoro, Diogo Dalot and Joshua Zirkzee all returned to training on the eve of the game.

title: Portugal coach: Ronaldo fit for Germany clash
content: Portugal coach Roberto Martínez has included Cristiano Ronaldo in his 27-player call-up for a June 4 Nations League semifinal match vs. Germany, dismissing rumours that the Al Nassr star is not in playing shape.

title: Maresca bemoans Chelsea schedule ahead of final
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca has made clear his unhappiness over his side's upcoming schedule ahead of the UEFA Conference League final.

title: Source: Man City back out of race for Wirtz
content: After meeting with Bayer Leverkusen and Florian Wirtz's representatives, Manchester City are turning their attention to other targets, a source told ESPN.

title: Ajax chief hints at Ten Hag return as head coach
content: Former Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag could be headed back to Ajax Amsterdam next season, the club's technical director said.

title: Laporta: Yamal's deal getting 'special treatment'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta has said that talks to extend Lamine Yamal's contract will end well, with the LaLiga champions prepared to give the teenager "special treatment."

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: J.K. Dobbins to the Commanders? Jalen Ramsey to the Rams? Best fits for free agents, trade candidates
content: Some unsigned free agents are still looking for new teams, while there are often trades before training camps start in July. Given that, let's find fits for 14 available players.

title: Where things stand for each Ryder Cup team after two majors
content: Which players are locks to make each team? What tough decisions will captains Keegan Bradley and Luke Donald have to make? We break down how each team is shaping up.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Pawan Kalyan felicitates Keeravani ahead of film Hari Hara Veera Mallu’s release
content: The music and background score composed by Keeravani for this film elevate the emotional highs of the story to their peak, says Deputy Chief Minister

title: There are no foreign nationals in twin cities, Police Commissioner clarifies
content: His clarification comes after Deputy Leader of Opposition in the Assembly Arvind Bellad accused the police of neglecting his complaint on the issue

title: Centre launches pilot apprenticeship scheme for northeast youth
content: ₹1,500 monthly support over existing stipend to benefit 26,000 candidates; scheme aims to address mobility and access barriers

title: Clamour to ban import of apples from Turkiye grows louder
content: Turkiye exports nearly 1.29 lakh metric tonnes of apples to India annually, a delegation of growers who met the Governor said

title: Medical shop operating without licence raided, illegal stock seized
content: During the raid on the shop in Alwal, DCA teams uncovered medicines that were stocked without authorisation for commercial sale

title: THiS schools in Kittur Karnataka excel in CBSE Class X exam
content: Students from schools under The Hindu In School programme have achieved excellent results in the Central Board of Secondary Education exam of Class X

title: An astrophysicist who inspired the younger generation
content: In Kerala, Jayant V. Narlikar, who passed away in Pune on May 20 aged 86, is remembered as a scientist who inspired countless youngsters in the study of science through his work, lectures and books.

title: Joint anti-sabotage checks conduct at Vijayawada railway station
content: Surprise raids were conducted in waiting halls, parcel office, parking places at the railway station in wake of the recent arrest of terror suspects in the State, the railway police said

title: War not an option to resolve issues with Pakistan: Mehbooba Mufti
content: THe PDP leader advocates diplomacy in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack and subsequent confrontation

title: Rohingya migration poses threat to internal security and jobs, says A.P. Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan
content: Pawan Kalyan writes letter to the DGP, calling for a strict vigil on the suspicious movements along the coastline

title: Top railway officer inspects overhead electrification work on Karaikal-Peralam new BG line section
content: The inspections comes days before the two-day mandatory inspection to be conducted by the Commissioner of Railway Safety, Southern Circle, Bengaluru

title: Rahul calls distribution of 1.11 lakh title deeds ‘sixth guarantee’, dream of Indira Gandhi fulfilled
content: At public gathering in Hosapete to mark two years of Congress government, he urges Karnataka government to complete distribution of title deeds to residents of remaining unauthorised settlements within six months

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Notification issued on extending route permits of buses to operate up to integrated bus terminus at Panjapur
content: There will be no change in fare for passengers travelling till the Central Bus Stand. They have to pay an additional charge as per the existing ticket fare per km, for travelling to the IBT.

title: President appoints Karnataka HC judge K. Somashekar as Chief Justice of Manipur High Court
content: The appointment came days after a three-member collegium headed by CJI B.R. Gavai had recommended this appointment in view of retirement of incumbent Chief Justice D. Krishnakumar on May 21

title: Hamilton is optimistic after Imola, but Leclerc showcases Ferrari's ills
content: Lewis Hamilton was giddy after Imola, but that shouldn't overshadow Charles Leclerc's frustrations at Ferrari.

title: Waiver wire: NL Central southpaws lead top picks
content: Eric Karabell outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: MLS: Miami sliding as Philly reeling in Caps
content: Inter Miami have lost five of its past seven, losing touch with the leaders of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea in for Gordon
content: Arsenal and Chelsea remain interested in signing Newcastle United winger Anthony Gordon. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Rain wreaks havoc in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: Rainfall of 165 mm was recorded in Thalassery and 32.6 mm in Taliparamba. With water level rising in rivers, authorities issued an orange alert

title: Protocol lapse: CJI says not to blow trivial issue out of proportion
content: A release of the Supreme Court issued on Tuesday (May 20, 2025) said everyone concerned had expressed regret.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate five railway stations redeveloped under Amrit Bharat scheme tomorrow
content: These five stations under South Western Railway have been upgraded, modernised at a total cost of ₹91.33 crore

title: Kannada actress Ranya Rao gets bail in gold smuggling case, but will stay in jail under COFEPOSA case
content: Ranya was arrested on March 3 after she flew into Bengaluru from Dubai. According to the DRI, she was found carrying 14.2 kg of foreign-origin gold bars worth ₹12.56 crore on her person

title: Ashoka University associate professor Mahmudabad sent to 14 days judicial custody
content: Separate FIRs were filed by Haryana State Women Commission Chairperson Renu Bhatia and Jathedi Sarpanch Yogesh Jathedi against him making similar allegations.

title: BRS to react on Ghose panel notices after going through content: Vinod Kumar
content: He suggests State govt. to take the Miss World pageant contestants to 125-ft Ambedkar statue, Amara Jyothi martyrs memorial

title: What is the 1991 K. Veeraswami judgment all about? | Explained
content: Why did Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar call for a revisit of the 1991 judgment? Who is K. Veeraswami? How did his case reach the Supreme Court? What did the Supreme Court rule in that judgment?

title: Universities in A.P. to have a minor paper on Quantum Computing
content: The APSCHE is to constitute Subject Committees for preparation of syllabi and the Universities have been asked to prepare a plan for training of teachers based on the new curriculum and introduction of courses on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)

title: PM Modi chairs meeting to review progress in tourism sector
content: Union Tourism Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, his deputy in the Tourism Ministry Suresh Gopi, Union Tourism Secretary V. Vidyavathi and top PMO officials attended the meeting

title: Unauthorised manufacture, sale of popular brand of steel sheets uncovered
content: Raids by officials on the premises of a number of traders revealed manufacturing and supply of duplicate products of Jindal (India) Limited

title: 5% fee hike for degree courses in government colleges in Karnataka
content: Officials of the department defended the increase saying that this will be applicable only for general merit students, as there is fee reimbursement for Scheduled Caste and Tribe, and girl students

title: Ghose panel on Kaleshwaram Barrages sends notices to KCR, Harish Rao and Eatala
content: They have been asked to appear before the Commission of Inquiry in the first and second weeks of June

title: Karnataka rain forecast live: Check rain warnings for your area
content: Explore rainfall forecasts issued for Karnataka and updating current rainfall intensity in the State.

title: Five workers killed in rockslide at Tamil Nadu’s Mallakottai stone quarry, CM announces solatium
content: Tamil Nadu Minister of Cooperation K.R. Periakaruppan, who visited the accident site, told journalists that the rescue operations were initially delayed as other workers had fled after the accident.

title: Road ministry cites 'critical lapses', expands oversight on NH works implemented by states
content: “State PWDs/RCDs shall not pursue such matters independently without consultation with ROs,” the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways circular said

title: Delhi Public School fee row: More parents join protest against fee hike, students' expulsion
content: Parents protest arbitrary fee hike and student expulsions at DPS branches, demand government intervention and transparency in fee regulations

title: Strong action will be taken if any Odisha link with espionage for Pakistan is found: Minister Prithiviraj Harichandan
content: Odisha Law Minister Prithiviraj Harichandan warned of strict legal action against anyone leaking sensitive information, amid a probe into a Puri-based YouTuber’s alleged links to accused spy Ms. Jyoti Malhotra.

title: Encroachments along streams in Ketti valley flood farmlands and roads, allege Nilgiris residents
content: C. Subramani, a Councillor said that in places where the stream course should be between 30 and 50-feet in width, it has been reduced to 10-15 feet

title: Agriculture activity likely to pick up from June first week with the onset of monsoon on June 4 in Vizianagaram
content: Vizianagaram Collector B. R. Ambedkar, District Agriculture Officer V. T. Rama Rao directed the officials to prepare an action plan for ensuring availablity of adequate quantity of seeds and fertilizers in all the mandals

title: 'No rule one must spend a year in jail for relief': Supreme Court grants bail in money laundering case
content: Supreme Court grants bail to businessman in ₹2,000 crore liquor scam case, citing no rule for year-long custody

title: Declare areas hit by shelling as 'war-impacted' zones: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Mehbooba Mufti also demanded that the families whose houses were destroyed in the shelling be provided ₹50 lakh each to support them in rebuilding their homes

title: Huge turnout for Tiranga Yatra in Shivamogga despite heavy rains
content: Participants carried a tricolour and raised slogans praising the soldiers for the success of Operation Sindoor, conducted in response to the terror attack at Pahalgam in Kashmir

title: Neyveli Lignite Corporation clocks record profit, coal-lignite production in 2024-25
content: The NLCIL has recommended a final dividend of 15% (1.5 per share), in addition to an interim dividend of 15%, for 2024-25 subject to approval of the next Annual General Meeting.

title: Watch: Maharashtra village gets public transport for first time since Independence
content: Situated in a Naxal-affected region, Katejhari in Gadchiroli district has long faced isolation and inaccessibility

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar bats for direct subsidy for farmers
content: “Indirect subsidy, there are always leakages. It does not achieve optimal results”, said Mr. Jagdeep Dhankhar on backing direct subsidy for farmers

title: How energy sufficient are India and its States?
content: Energy gaps in the North-East and East are being plugged by the transmission sector as India aims to boost its renewable capacity to 500 GW by 2030

title: NIA, IB grilling Haryana YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra arrested for spying for Pakistan, says Police
content: A senior Haryana Police officer said the central agencies and military intelligence officials are also probing her travel details, as she had reportedly visited Pakistan, China and some other countries

title: Delhi Government to provide proper facilities to sportspersons:  Chief Minister Rekha Gupta
content: Delhi Games-2025 inaugurated with focus on providing facilities for sportspersons by Delhi government, says Chief Minister Gupta

title: 3/4th of India's population at 'high' to 'very high' heat risk: CEEW study
content: The CEEW study released on May 20, 2025, identified Delhi, Maharashtra, Goa, Kerala, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, and three more as the top 10 regions at highest heat risk

title: Heavy rains: Chikkamagaluru DC issues advisory
content: Deputy Commissioner Meena Nagaraj has appealed to people not to venture into rivers and to avoid low-lying areas. There are chances of landslips due to heavy rains

title: Ola Krutrim says it is extending full support to family of employee who died
content: Ola's AI arm Krutrim on Sunday said it is extending full support to the family of an employee whose body was retrieved from a lake

title: Monsoon expected to reach Kerala later this week, says IMD
content: IMD forecasts monsoon onset over Kerala in next four to five days, along with further advances over parts of Lakshadweep, T.N.; this will be the earliest onset date of the southwest monsoon since 2009

title: Kerala women’s team wins Spirit Championship at national-level Ultimate Frisbee tournament on debut
content: The 19-member team won the title for the upholding the spirit of the game, despite a group-stage exit at the fourth edition of the Bharat Trophy

title: India, United States discuss expediting conclusion of first phase of trade pact
content: Piyush Goyal met U.S. Secretary Howard Lutnick in Washington to speed up talks on the first phase of the India-U.S. trade deal

title: Heavy rains lash Udupi and Manipal, muddy water enters some shops
content: Slush (muddy) water entered some shops in Laxmindranagar and to some shops on the basement of Central Park Complex near INOX

title: In Pictures | Rain fury in Udupi, Manipal
content: The IMD had issued a red alert (extremely heavy rainfall above 204.5 mm) for coastal Karnataka on May 20 and May 21

title: Public gathering to mark two years of Congress government in Karnataka begins amid torrential rains in Hosapete
content: Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda, who welcomed the dignitaries and the public, described the rain as a divine blessing for a government that, in his view, has fulfilled its promises

title: Krishnagiri’s KRP, Kelavarapalli dams opened; flood alert issued for three districts
content: Krishnagiri received an average rainfall of 24.31 mm with Hosur recording the maximum rainfall of 74.4mm, followed by Denkanikottai receiving 57 mm.

title: Trinamool Congress nominates Abhishek Banerjee to be part of all-party delegation on Operation Sindoor
content: Trinamool Congress had opted out from the all-party panel when the Centre nominated MP Yusuf Pathan to be part of one such delegation

title: Heavy rain inundates Guwahati, normal life affected
content: Rainwater accumulated in hundreds of houses in the ‘smart’ city, and there were reports of power cuts in many areas

title: Brajesh Pathak renews attack on Akhilesh Yadav, says he is willing to have thesis written on Samajwadi Party's DNA
content: U.P. Deputy CM criticised Akhilesh Yadav for evading the core issue of appeasement, remarking that he responded to a political question with a home science guide

title: Chhagan Bhujbal, OBC stalwart who kept himself relevant amid changes in Maharashtra politics
content: Chhagan Bhujbal's political career began with the Shiv Sena in the 1980s, winning the Mazgaon assembly seat (Mumbai) in 1986 and 1990.

title: Gold smuggling case: Actress Ranya Rao gets bail, but to remain in jail
content: Ranya Rao and Tarun Raju secured default bail from a Bengaluru court in a gold smuggling case due to the DRI's delayed chargesheet filing. Despite this, Ranya remains detained under the COFEPOSA Act. The case involves the seizure of smuggled gold worth crores and multiple Dubai trips, leading to charges under the Customs Act and investigations into financial violations.

title: Pak govt promotes army chief Asim Munir to field marshal
content: In a surprising move, the Pakistan government has promoted General Asim Munir to the rank of field marshal, a decision made during a cabinet meeting led by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif. This elevation follows recent tensions, including India's precision strikes on terrorist spots and thwarted Pakistani drone attacks, culminating in a ceasefire agreement between the two nations.

title: JPMorgan Chase to managers: 'Resist hiring, remember attrition … '
content: JPMorgan Chase is implementing a hiring slowdown, prioritizing efficiency gains through artificial intelligence. The bank anticipates a 10% reduction in operations staff due to AI advancements in areas like fraud and payment processing. While overall headcount growth is being curbed, strategic hiring will continue in key areas such as banking, advising, and branch expansion.

title: Can Yuki Bhambri lead India's challenge in French Open 2025?
content: Yuki Bhambri, now India's No. 2 doubles player, is navigating a challenging clay court season leading up to Roland Garros. Despite inconsistent partnerships and early exits in recent tournaments, Bhambri remains focused on improving his performance and aiming for success at the upcoming Grand Slam events. He also acknowledges Rohan Bopanna's significant contribution to Indian tennis.

title: How govt chose 25 countries for all-party delegation anti-terror outreach
content: Following Operation Sindoor, the Indian government is dispatching all-party parliamentary delegations to 25 key nations, including UNSC members and future members, starting May 23. This 10-day outreach aims to counter Pakistan's narrative on terrorism and present a united Indian front. Senior MPs will lead the delegations, emphasizing India's zero tolerance for terrorism and commitment to national security on global platforms.

title: HI official clears the air on Pak's participation in Asia Cup hockey in India
content: Amid heightened tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Hockey India will adhere to the government's decision regarding Pakistan's participation in the upcoming Asia Cup, scheduled in Rajgir. Bholanath Singh, Hockey India's secretary general, emphasised that the country's interests take precedence. While the Pakistan Hockey Federation has requested visa guarantees, Hockey India awaits government directives, prioritising the nation's honour above all else.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6,000 laid off employees: "These are people who…"
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: 'Answers for next year': Dhoni looks ahead to IPL 2026 after CSK's exit
content: Captain MS Dhoni acknowledged Chennai Super Kings' early exit from IPL 2025, stating the team is now focused on experimenting and planning for the next season, particularly improving their bowling. Despite the disappointing season, Dhoni emphasised the franchise isn't under pressure and is looking at combinations for a rebuild for next year.

title: IPL 2025 playoffs schedule announced: Final to be held in Ahmedabad
content: The BCCI has announced the schedule and venues for the IPL 2025 playoffs. New PCA Stadium in New Chandigarh will host Qualifier 1 on May 29 and the Eliminator on May 30. Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium will then host Qualifier 2 on June 1 and the final on June 3.

title: Truth Berns: How Democrats became undemocratic
content: The Democratic Party, it seems, ceased being fully democratic well before Donald Trump ever stepped behind a teleprompter. The internal erosion began in the Obama era and became painfully clear in the 2016 primaries, when Sanders ran an insurgent campaign powered by small-dollar donors and grassroots mobilisation. Despite winning multiple states, Sanders found himself outmanoeuvred by a party establishment aligned with Hillary Clinton, aided by unelected superdelegates and a Democratic National Committee (DNC) whose neutrality was seriously in question.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai shares Google I/O excitement with these photos
content: Google's I/O 2025 kicks off today with Sundar Pichai's keynote, focusing heavily on AI advancements. Anticipated announcements include new Gemini features for phones and more powerful AI models, alongside updates on Project Astra. The event may also showcase Android XR, including prototype smart glasses, positioning Google in the XR software race.

title: Akshay Kumar to sue Paresh Rawal over Hera Pheri 3 exit: Top 5 news
content: Showbiz is buzzing with news! Siddhant Chaturvedi and Sara Tendulkar's rumored romance ended swiftly, while Mukesh Rishi defended Salman Khan's friendly nature. The 'War 2' teaser dropped, showcasing Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's epic clash. Akshay Kumar is reportedly suing Paresh Rawal for ₹25 crore over his 'Hera Pheri 3' exit.

title: Senior Jharkhand IAS officer arrested in liquor scam case
content: Jharkhand IAS officer Vinay Kumar Choubey was arrested by Chhattisgarh's anti-corruption bureau in connection with a liquor scam. An FIR was filed against Choubey for allegedly causing financial losses to Jharkhand's exchequer by altering the state's liquor policy. The syndicate allegedly manipulated tender norms to favor certain companies, earning illegal commissions.

title: YouTuber, trader, student, security guard: 12 'spies' come from all walks of life
content: Indian authorities have arrested at least 12 individuals across Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh for alleged espionage linked to Pakistan. The suspects, including a YouTuber, are accused of sharing sensitive information with Pakistani Intelligence Operatives. Investigations revealed contact with a Pakistani official at the Pakistan High Commission in Delhi, who has since been expelled.

title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan at Cannes Film Festival with Aaradhya- Watch
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan has arrived at the Cannes Film Festival 2025 with her daughter, Aaradhya Bachchan, greeted warmly at Nice airport. Aishwarya sported a navy blue trench coat, while Aaradhya wore a black coat. The actress previously shared that Aaradhya enjoys Cannes for its familiar and sociable atmosphere, feeling at home amidst the celebration of cinema.

title: Tata’s this move to help Apple diversify awayfromChina
content: Tata Electronics has initiated iPhone assembly, including the iPhone 16 series, at its Hosur facility, a move that may challenge Foxconn's dominance in the smartphone supply chain.

title: 'United in fight against terrorism': PM Modi speaks to German Chancellor Merz
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has congratulated Friedrich Merz on becoming the new Chancellor of Germany, as both leaders committed to strengthening the strategic partnership between India and Germany. They exchanged perspectives on global and regional issues, reinforcing their united stance against terrorism. Merz's election followed a historic second-round victory, marking him as Germany's 10th chancellor since World War II.

title: Who is new Baba Vanga? Earthquake, tsunami & massive disaster predicted in '25
content: Amidst recent global disasters, a prediction by Japanese manga artist Ryo Tatsuki, dubbed Japan's "Baba Vanga," has sparked widespread concern. Tatsuki forecasts a mega-tsunami south of Japan in July 2025, triggered by an underwater volcanic eruption, potentially impacting Japan, Taiwan, and Indonesia.

title: 'Pant's problems can be fixed in five minutes': Ex-India cricketer's big claim
content: Rishabh Pant's struggles continued as Lucknow Super Giants were eliminated from IPL 2025 playoff contention after a loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad. Pant's poor form, scoring only 7 runs, has drawn criticism. However, Yograj Singh believes Pant's technical flaws are easily fixable, while Pant attributes the team's struggles to injuries of key bowlers.

title: Briefing foreign nations on Op Sindoor before Parliament unacceptable: D Raja
content: CPI leader D Raja criticises the government's briefing of foreign countries on Operation Sindoor while keeping Indians uninformed, demanding a special Parliament session. He questions the lack of consultation with political parties regarding the all-party delegations and raises concerns about suppressed dissent, citing the arrest of an Ashoka University professor.

title: Ashoka University prof Ali Khan sent to judicial custody over post on Op Sindoor
content: Professor Ali Khan Mahmoodabad of Ashoka University has been remanded to judicial custody until May 27 following his arrest over a social media post concerning 'Operation Sindoor.' Two FIRs were filed against him, prompting the Haryana women’s commission to issue a notice.

title: Nifty ends below 24,700 - top 5 reasons market fell
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, tanked in trade on Tuesday afternoon, influenced by subdued global market conditions, selling pressure, and reserved approach from institutional investors.

title: Major telecom outage hits Spain, weeks after electricity blackout
content: A major communication breakdown hit Spain on Tuesday, disrupting internet and landline services nationwide. Thousands of Movistar and O2 customers, both under Telefónica, experienced fibre optic connectivity loss. The widespread outage even impacted emergency response systems, forcing authorities to issue alternative contact numbers as the national '112' line was affected.

title: Preity Zinta lashes out over edited image with young RR star
content: Preity Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, has condemned a fabricated image circulating online that falsely depicts her hugging Rajasthan Royals' young player, Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Zinta refuted the morphed image as fake news, expressing surprise that news channels were also using it. The actual video shows a brief greeting and handshake between Zinta and Suryavanshi.

title: Long before Jyoti, Pak had honey-trapped Madhuri
content: The arrest of YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra for allegedly sharing military secrets with Pakistan has echoes of the Madhuri Gupta case. Gupta, an Indian diplomat in Islamabad, was arrested in 2010 for espionage. She was honey-trapped by Pakistani intelligence, passing sensitive information after being manipulated by promises of love.

title: Who is Dr. Kevin O'Connor, the doc under fire for Biden's cancer diagnosis?
content: Former President Joe Biden's recent prostate cancer diagnosis, which has spread to his bones, has sparked controversy surrounding his former White House physician, Dr. Kevin O'Connor.

title: 'Save Indian cricket': Yograj urges Rohit, Kohli to reconsider Test retirement
content: Yograj Singh voices apprehension over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's potential Test retirements, emphasizing the necessity of their experience for the upcoming series against England. He urges them to reconsider, highlighting the importance of national pride and fan emotions. Yograj also calls on the BCCI to support players during tough times, referencing past instances of abrupt player dismissals.

title: Bangladeshi actress, Nusraat Faria, charged with attempted murder, gets bail
content: Bangladeshi actress Nusraat Faria, recognized for her roles in several films, was arrested at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka on charges related to an attempted murder case. She was reportedly on her way to Thailand when authorities detained her. Subsequently, Nusraat Faria has been granted bail by Dhaka Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Court Judge Mostafizur Rahman after submitting a statement.

title: Centre urges Supreme Court to confine waqf hearing to three issue
content: The Centre has urged the Supreme Court to limit hearings on pleas challenging the Waqf Act's validity to three specific issues, for which it has already submitted a comprehensive affidavit. These issues concern the denotification of waqf properties, the composition of waqf boards, and the treatment of waqf property when its status as government land is being investigated.

title: Brian Williams, ex-Texas A&M safety, dies of heat stroke after half marathon
content: Brian Williams, a former Texas A&M safety, passed away at 24. He suffered a severe heat stroke after a half marathon. Williams played for the Aggies for three seasons. He earned his engineering degree in 2024. Tributes poured in from family, friends, and former teammates. Heat stroke occurs when the body overheats, often during physical activity in hot weather.

title: Peppa Pig’s family just got bigger: Sweet meaning behind baby sister’s name
content: After much anticipation, Peppa Pig's family has welcomed a new member, Evie. The arrival was celebrated with royal-inspired fanfare, complete with a town crier and official birth certificate. Mummy Pig shared the emotional significance behind the name, revealing it was chosen in honor of her Great Aunt, while also highlighting its meaning of 'life' and 'living one'.

title: Kharge again claims PM had intel on Pahalgam: 'Why didn't you tell tourists?'
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has criticized the Modi government for alleged security lapses in Pahalgam, claiming negligence led to the deaths of 26 tourists. Speaking at a rally in Karnataka, Kharge questioned why the government didn't advise tourists against visiting the area.

title: Benefit for India: How Indian ports will gain from China+1 strategy - Moody’s explains
content: Indian ports are set to benefit from the global China+1 strategy as companies diversify manufacturing beyond China, according to Moody's Ratings. This shift could significantly boost port activity in India.

title: Samson breaks silence: 'Last time when Dhoni came out to bat ... '
content: Sanju Samson spoke about MS Dhoni's impact. He recalled the electrifying atmosphere when Dhoni batted in Chennai. Samson admitted the 'Dhoni effect' transcends venues. CSK prepares for their final match against RR. Stephen Fleming remained tight-lipped about Dhoni’s future. The season has been underwhelming for CSK. Rajasthan Royals have faced missed opportunities. Samson’s words remind everyone of Dhoni's magical presence.

title: Explained: Why CBSE's new sugar boards are a timely wake-up call
content: To combat rising health issues among students, the CBSE has introduced 'Sugar Boards' in Indian schools. These visually engaging displays will educate children about the dangers of excessive sugar intake, highlighting the sugar content in common snacks and healthier alternatives. Schools are also encouraged to conduct workshops and health checkups.

title: 'Army fully destroyed military infra in PoK's Leepa Valley during Op Sindoor'
content: The Indian Army's Chinar Corps executed Operation Sindoor, decimating military infrastructure in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir's Leepa Valley, including posts, ammunition depots, and fuel storage. Officials estimate it will take Pakistan 8-12 months to rebuild, following retaliation for ceasefire violations. India also destroyed nine terror camps in Pakistan and PoK in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 5 dead in 36 hours: Relentless rains leave Bengaluru gasping for relief
content: Bengaluru grappled with severe disruptions due to continuous heavy rainfall, leading to widespread waterlogging and traffic congestion. Tragically, rain-related incidents caused five fatalities, including electrocutions and a wall collapse. The IMD issued an orange alert for Bengaluru, anticipating further heavy rainfall and advising residents to take precautions, while authorities worked to evacuate and assist affected communities.

title: 'Spy ring': Kolkata influencer says Jyoti showed no interest in security sites
content: A Kolkata-based social media influencer, currently under scrutiny, has disclosed his interactions with YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, arrested for alleged espionage for Pakistan's ISI. He met Malhotra during her Kolkata visit in February, following an initial encounter at the Ram Temple inauguration in Ayodhya.

title: If Shubman Gill is India's next Test captain, who will be his deputy?
content: With Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli stepping away from Test cricket, the leadership mantle is up for grabs. Shubman Gill is poised to take over as Test captain, but it comes with a rider - who will be his deputy, a designated vice-captain, captain-in-waiting, or, in Indian cricketing history, a powerless foot-soldier.

title: Abhishek Banerjee to represent TMC in all-party delegation on Operation Sindoor
content: Following discussions between parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee, the Trinamool Congress has nominated Abhishek Banerjee to represent the party in parliamentary delegations related to Operation Sindoor. This decision follows Banerjee's emphasis on the need for inclusive consultations in selecting delegation members. He also suggested including family members of martyrs and officers involved in Operation Sindoor.

title: QB tiers for every FBS program: Returning stars and, of course, Arch Manning
content: 2025 is the unofficial end point of the bonus year . if you're Diego Pavia, who might play until he's eligible to collect social security . some of last season's rules allowed players to stick around for five, six or even seven years .

title: How Amorim, Man United made it to the Europa League final in spite of themselves
content: Ruben Amorim has been working 14-hour days at united's carrington training ground . the club have reached historically low depths that have left him "really embarrassed" if they beat Spurs at Estadio Salinas, they will face Tottenham in the Europa League final .

title: Eight things we learned from the WNBA's opening weekend
content: the 2025 WNBA season is off and running . there's only so much to take away from a small sample size of games to begin the grind . some slow starts can turn around -- see the Fever last season making the playoffs after opening 1-8 .

title: NBA playoffs betting: How to bet the conference finals
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder take on the Minnesota Timberwolves in the Western Conference . the new york Knicks face the Indiana Pacers in the eastern conference . for latest odds go to ESPN BET Timberwolves +1.5 games (+140)

title: Experts' picks for Pacers-Knicks, Timberwolves-Thunder
content: no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder advanced to the Western Conference finals . it is the Thunder's first trip to the conference finals since the 2015-16 campaign . the Minnesota Timberwolves rolled into the West finals after taking care of the Golden State Warriors in five games .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Michael Morales still unbeaten, no longer unranked
content: morales knocked out onetime title challenger Gilbert Burns in the top 10 . he moved to 18-0 with a first-round TKO of Burns . the other significant movement in the divisional rankings came because of inactivity .

title: Stanley Cup conference finals preview: Goalie confidence ratings, X factors for NHL's final four
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs field is down to the final four . the Carolina Hurricanes and the Florida Panthers face off in a rematch of the 2023 Eastern Conference finals, while the Western Conference finales are a return bout from 2024 . Ryan S. Clark and Kristen Shilton are here with intel on all four teams.

title: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the LSU Tigers remain no. 1 but there was plenty of shakeup in the rest of the rankings . this week's biggest risers were Southern Miss, who jumped up nine spots, and the surging Florida Gators, who are now at no. 15 .

title: Scottie Scheffler is still on top of the golf world
content: charLOTTE, n.c., wins his third career major title . scottie Scheffler finishes 12 under par to secure his third major championship . sergio aguero finishes 12th under par after a stern facial expression .

title: Was Imola a one-off or is Verstappen now a title contender?
content: Max Verstappen finishes ahead of Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri to win the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix . the four-time world champion returns to his happy place for 63 laps . he was beaten by a 22-point deficit in the championship at the japanese grand prix .
